<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-81
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage206"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notes to the consolidated financial statements (continued)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenues from one customer, arising from sales within the quicklime segment, amounted to
	S/27,182,000, S/28,518,000 and S/22,450,000 in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capital expenditure consists of S/ 490,807,000,
	S/587,244,000 and S/210,594,000 during the years ended as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, and are related to additions of property, plant and equipment, exploration and evaluation assets and other minor non-current assets.
	During 2015, 2014 and 2013, there were no purchases of assets through capital leases.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Inter-segment revenues are eliminated on
	consolidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The &#147;other&#148; segment includes activities that do not meet the threshold for disclosure under IFRS 8.13 and
	represent non-material operations of the Group (including phosphates and brine projects).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Other assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 corresponds to the available-for-sale investments caption and fair value of financial derivate instrument (cross
	currency swap) for approximately S/436,000 and S/124,770,000, respectively (S/744,000 and S/12,251,000 respectively as of December&nbsp;21, 2014), which are not allocated to a segment. As of December&nbsp;31, 2013 corresponds to the
	available-for-sale investments caption for approximately S/36,058,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Geographic information
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All revenues are from Peruvian clients.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, all non-current assets are located in Peru.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-82
</P>
</EFX_FORM>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage207"></A>
<A NAME="D175739DEX11_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_1>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_1"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	EXHIBIT 1.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/04/29/0001193125-16-569808_G175739G0428030206246.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
<U>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:21%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	BYLAWS
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	I.
<U>
	NAME,
	PURPOSE, REGISTERED OFFICE, DURATION, DATE OF
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<U>
	COMMENCEMENT OF ACTIVITIES
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIRST ARTICLE
</U>
	.&nbsp;CEMENTOS PACASMAYO S.A.A. is a company organized under the form of a publicly held company, subject to the General Law of
	Companies, to the Law of Securities Market and other applicable provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The company shall be named
<B>
	&#147;CEMENTOS PACASMAYO SOCIEDAD ANONIMA
	ABIERTA&#148;
</B>
	or its abbreviation
<B>
	&#147;CEMENTOS PACASMAYO S.A.A.&#148;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	SECOND ARTICLE.
</U>
	The purpose of the Company preparing and
	manufacturing cements, lime, aggregates, blocks and cement bricks, concrete pre-mix and other construction material, its derivatives and similar, including its trading and sale in the Republic of Peru and abroad. The company may also carry out all
	kinds of mining activities such as prospecting, exploration, development, exploitation, merchandising, benefit and transport; as well as any activity related with goods transport service in general, materials and hazardous wastes, including chemical
	supplies and controlled goods; and execute and subscribe all acts and suitable contracts for the fulfillment of its purpose, including activities to acquire, sell, build, lease and manage real and personal property and perform all civil and
	commercial activities that are convenient, including its participation in other companies in the Republic of Peru and abroad.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRD ARTICLE
</U>
	. The
	address of the Company shall be in the province and department of Lima. The Company may establish agencies, branch offices and offices in any place in the Republic of Peru and/or abroad, by Board of Directors&#146; resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FOURTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The duration of the Company shall be perpetual, having commenced activities December
	10
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	1998.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	II.
<U>
	CAPITAL STOCK AND SHARES
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The capital Stock of the company is S/. 531&#146;461,479 (Five hundred thirty-one million, four hundred sixty-one thousand, four hundred
	seventy-nine and 00/100 Nuevos Soles) that shall be represented by 531&#146;461,479 shares with S/. 1.00 (Nuevo Sol) par value, fully subscribed and totally paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	SIXTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The liability of each shareholder shall be limited to the amount of his contribution according to the nominal value of the shares of
	which he is holder.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage208"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	SEVENTH ARTICLE.
</U>
	The shares are nominal and will have titles that shall be recorded in certificates or
	account entries. One sole title can represent one or more shares of one owner or joint owners.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The certificates shall be signed by two Directors and will
	include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. The name of the company, its capital stock, domicile, and duration, the date of the public deed of incorporation and the Notary
	before whom it was issued, as well as the information of its registration in the Public Registry.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. The name of the shareholder, the issuance date, the
	serial number, the number and the class of shares it represents and the number each share bears.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. The nominal value per share, the amount paid and
	subsequent payments that are made on account of their nominal value or the statement that the shares are totally paid.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. Liens or charges that could
	have been established on the share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provisional Certificates of Shares or Subscription Records may be issued, under the terms of Article 87 of the
	General Corporations Law as a result of capital increases agreed by the Company, subject to the applicable laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The account entries shall be made
	according to the applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	EIGHT ARTICLE
</U>
	. The company shall recognize as owner of each share whoever appears as such in the &#147;Registry
	of Shares&#148; to be kept by the Company. Also registered, shall be the consecutive transfers of shares and the establishment of real rights or court measures that could affect the same.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When there is a legal action concerning the ownership of the shares, the Company shall admit the exercise of the rights of shareholders to the person to be
	considered as holder, pursuant to provisions of foregoing paragraph, except if otherwise ordered by court mandate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	NINTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. There are no
	limitations, restrictions or priorities in a transfer of shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company shall not recognize agreements between shareholders containing limitations,
	restrictions or priorities to a free transfer of shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The preferential right of shareholders to subscribe increase of capital
	stock with new contributions is incorporated to a security, called certificate of preferential subscription or by a notation on account, both freely transferable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Shareholders cannot exercise this shareholder&#146;s right if they are in default in dividends payable and their shares will not be calculated to establish
	the prorate participation in preferential right.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There is no preferential right of subscription in an increase of capital stock by conversion of
	obligations into shares, in the case of articles 103 and 259 of the General Law of Companies, or in cases of reorganization of companies stipulated in above mentioned law.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage209"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting can decide that shareholders do not have preferential right of
	subscription who are believed to fall under cases established in article 259 of the General Law of Companies, provided requirements provided in said article are met.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The content of a certificate of preferential subscription, and its exercise and procedure of subscription, is ruled by legal provisions on this subject matter
	stipulated in the General Law of Companies and in the Law of Securities Market and provisions established by the General Meeting, or otherwise by the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	ELEVENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. Each share gives right to a vote, except for election of Board of Director purposes, when it will be subject to provision of article
	164 of the General Law of Companies.&nbsp;Each share is indivisible and cannot be represented but by one person only.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Always when by inheritance or any
	other title or right, legal or contractual, a number of natural persons acquire the joint property of one or more shares, they shall designate, among the co-owners, one among them to exercise the rights of shareholder, certifying in writing such
	designation, either through private or public instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In case of disability, impairment or inconvenience of all the co-owners, they shall designate
	an common attorney that will exercise their rights, certifying in writing such appointment and indicating whether the term is fixed or indefinite.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All
	such designations referred to in his article shall be accredited and notified to the Company, and shall be considered valid before the Company until a revocation has been notified.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWELFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. In the case of loss or destruction of the titles representing the shares, the issue of new titles will be completed, after procedures
	determined by law and upon the guaranties that the Board of Directors shall deem convenient.&nbsp;The cost shall be charged to the applicant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. Any shareholder for the fact of so being, is subject to the Bylaws of the Company and resolutions of the General Shareholders&#146;
	Meeting and the Board of Directors, adopted pursuant to this same Bylaws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	III.
<U>
	CORPORATE BODIES
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FOURTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The company bodies are: the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting, the Board of Directors, and Management.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage210"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	IV.
<U>
	GENERAL SHAREHOLDERS MEETINGS
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting is the supreme body of the company, and decides on any of the matters proper of its
	competence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	SIXTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall be called to meet in the place of the corporate domicile or in the
	place indicated in the call.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the written request of shareholders representing at least three fourths of the shares subscribed with right to vote, or
	by resolution of the Board of Directors by unanimous vote of attendees, can hold a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting in a different place, whether in the county or abroad.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	SEVENTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting will meet at least once a year within the first three months following the end of each
	annual fiscal year; this meeting is called the Annual Mandatory General Shareholders&#146; Meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	EIGHTEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting will meet in any place when decided by the Board of Directors or requested by notary means by a number of shareholders representing at least five percent of subscribed shares with right to vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	NINETEENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Board of Directors gives notice of Shareholders&#146; Meetings through a published notice once in the Official Gazette &#147;El
	Peruano&#148;, and in one of major circulation newspaper of Lima at least twenty-five calendar days in advance to the date the Annual Mandatory Shareholders&#146; Meeting is to be held and when any other General Shareholders&#146; Meeting is to be
	held.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The notice may also contain the date in which a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting will be held in second or third call. In this case, between one
	and the next call, not less than three and no more than ten calendar days must pass.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The notice shall specify the date, time and place where the meeting
	will be held and the subject matters to be discussed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTIETH ARTICLE
</U>
	. When a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting is not held if more than half
	an hour has passed and there is no quorum, or is not held for any other reason, a second call shall be made, unless the latter has been provided for in the notice referred to in foregoing article
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The second call shall be made within the next thirty-calendar days to the date the Meeting was not held upon de first call, and the third call within an equal
	term from the second, with the same requirements of the notice specified in the first call.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY FIRST ARTICLE
</U>
	. A General Shareholders&#146;
	Meeting can be held without need of prior notice provided all shareholders present or represented, represent all shares subscribed with right to vote and record their unanimous consent to meet and discuss the matters proposed in the Book of Minutes.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY SECOND ARTICLE
</U>
	. Entitled to attend a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting, with voice and vote, are
	the holders of shares with right to vote registered in the Registry of Shares, ten calendar days previous to the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Also entitled to attend a
	General Shareholders&#146; Meeting are, with voice not vote, the Directors and Managers of the Company that are not shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By invitation,
	Attorneys, Auditors and Officers of the Company, not being shareholders, may attend a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting, as well as individuals determined by the Meeting, all of which will have voice but not vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY THIRD ARTICLE
</U>
	. Shareholders can be represented by a proxy in General Meetings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The representation shall be notified by simple letter, cable, telex, fax or any other means of communication that can issue a written certification,
	understanding that the representation is for each General Meeting, except when the Power of Attorney is granted through a Public Instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The powers
	need to be registered with the Company until to the day before the Meeting is held.&nbsp;Any person can represent one or several shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY
	FOURTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. A General Meeting to be hold in first call, the requirement is that the attendance, personal or through proxies or attorneys in fact, of shareholders represent at least fifty percent of subscribed shares with right to vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the second or third call, the attendance of any number of subscribed shares with right to vote shall suffice.&nbsp;The exception to the provision in this
	article is stipulated in the next article.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY FIFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. A General Shareholders&#146; Meeting that will discuss the increase or reduction
	of the capital stock, the issue of obligations, transformation, merge, split off, reorganization or dissolution of the corporation, the resolution to sell, in one only act, the assets whose book value exceeds fifty percent of the capital stock of
	the company, and in general, any modification of the Bylaws, requires, for the first call, the attendance, personal or through proxies or attorneys in fact, of shareholders represent at least fifty percent of subscribed shares with right to vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the second call, it will suffice the representation of at least twenty-five percent of subscribed shares with right to vote,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event this quorum is not reached in second call, the General Meeting will be held in third call, when any number of subscribed shares with right to
	vote shall suffice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY SIXTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall be chaired by the President and in his absence, by the
	Vice-president.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If both are absent, it shall be presided by whoever is representing the greater number of shares, and when two or
	more meet these same conditions, then it will be by lot.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company Manager shall act as Secretary or, in his absence or impairment, then the person who
	the General Meeting will appoint in each case.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY SEVENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Annual Mandatory General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Discuss the corporate management and economic results of previous fiscal year, expressed in the financial statements for such period.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Decide on the application of company profits, if any,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Choose when necessary, the members of the Board of Directors and fix their remuneration.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designate or delegate upon the Board the appointment of external auditors, when required,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Decide on other proper matters pursuant to these Bylaws and any other specified in the call.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY EIGHTH
	ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting also shall:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Remove the members of the Board at any time and without need to express cause, and choose who are to replace them,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amend the Bylaws,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Increase or reduce the capital stock,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Issue obligations,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Agree the sale, in one single action, of assets whose book value exceeds fifty percent of the company capital stock,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	F.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Agree on investigations, audits or balances,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	G.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Transform, merge, split off, reorganize, dissolve and liquidate the company,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	H.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Decide on any kind of matters, provided the law or the Bylaws agree an intervention, and in any other matter that requires a corporate interest.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	TWENTY NINTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The resolutions of a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall be adopted by absolute majority of subscribed shares with right to
	vote representing such majority.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTIETH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The right to vote shall not be exercised by shareholders that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Are late in paying their contributions to the company.&nbsp;The shares that are not entitled to exercise their right to vote shall not be accounted for to complete quorum or to establish a majority vote.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Have, in the matters submitted to the General Meeting, on their own right or third party right, a conflict of interest with the company.&nbsp;The shares that are not entitled to exercise their right to vote shall not be
	accounted for to complete quorum or to establish a majority vote.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY FIRST ARTICLE
</U>
	. At the request of shareholders representing
	not less than twenty-five percent of subscribed shares with right to vote, the General
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Meeting may be adjourned only once, for not less than three days and no more than five calendar days, and without need of a new call, for the discussion and vote of matters upon which the
	shareholders so requesting it, deemed not being sufficiently informed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any number of meetings in which the Meeting is eventually held, shall be deemed as
	only one, and a single minutes shall be draw up.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY SECOND ARTICLE
</U>
	. The resolutions of the General Meeting shall be recorded in the minutes
	draw up in a special book, certified according to Law, and kept by the company manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY THIRD ARTICLE
</U>
	. When under any circumstance, the
	minutes of a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting cannot be draw up in respective book; a special document shall be issued, with the same formalities and requirements, specified in foregoing article.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The text of the special document shall be adhere or transcribed timely, in the book of minutes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY FOURTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting established, subject to provisions set forth in these Bylaws, legally represents all the
	shareholders of the company, and its resolutions bind them all, including dissidents and those not attending the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	V.
<U>
	BOARD OF
	DIRECTORS
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY FIFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Board of Directors is the executive body of resolutions adopted by the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting,
	exercises the authority and rights concerning the representation, management and administration of the company; and it is under their competence to decide any business that by law or by these Bylaws are not expressly reserved to the General
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting. The Board can meet within or outside the company premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Board shall be formed by a minimum of 7 (seven) members and a
	maximum of 11 (eleven) members. Before the election, The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall decide on the number of Directors to elect for the applicable period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the Board can have a minimum of 3 (thee) Alternate Directors and a maximum of 5 (five) Alternate Directors that shall be elected by the General
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting, in the same way as the Regular Directors and rule over them all legal and statutory provisions applicable to regular members when attending in their stead.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Alternate Directors may attend any Board meeting.&nbsp;The President of the Board shall designate the Alternate Director or Directors that will replace the
	Regular Director, as applicable, on a definite fashion in a case of vacancy, or on a temporary fashion in the event of absence or impediment.&nbsp;The simple vacancy, absence or impediment of a regular member fully validates the acting of the
	alternate member who replaces him.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage214"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY SIXTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. For the purposes of election of the Board, and Alternate Directors, each share gives
	right to as many votes as directors need to be elected, and each shareholder can accumulate his votes in behalf of one person only or distribute it among various.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Directors will be proclaimed when they obtain a greater number of votes, following the order of these.&nbsp;When two or more persons obtain an equal number of
	votes and all of them cannot be part of the Board because the fixed number of directors according to these Bylaws will not allow it, it will be decided by lot, who among them shall become member of the Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This article is not applicable when the directors are elected unanimously.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY SEVENTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The office of Director ends:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	By resignation, death, illness, civil impairment or another cause that definitely prevents him to exercise his functions,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	When the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting so agrees, in the form provided for in sub item A) of article twentieth.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY EIGHTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. In the case of vacancy from office of any of the Directors, while a new election shall take place by the General
	Shareholders&#146; Meeting, the Board shall designate the Alternate Director that will replace him on a definite manner.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In case there is a vacancy of
	Directors in a number such that the Board cannot meet validly, the regular Directors will assume ad interim the administration and shall call promptly a General Shareholders&#146; Meeting, to elect the missing Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	THIRTY NINTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Directors will elect among them, a President, who will chair their meetings, and the General Shareholders&#146; Meetings, and
	a Vice-president, who will exercise the same functions in the case of absence or impediment of the former.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When neither the President of the Board nor
	the Vice-president attend, the meeting shall chaired by the oldest Director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Acting as the Secretary of the meeting shall be the Manager of the company
	or, in his absence, the person that in each case is designated by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Company Attorneys, Auditors and Officers of the Company, may attend the
	Board Meeting, at the invitation of the latter, all of which will have voice but not vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTIETH ARTICLE.
</U>
	The Directors will be appointed for
	three (3) year-long periods, except for appointments made to complete a term. The Directors can be reelected by one or more additional periods.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage215"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Board may appoint one or more Directors to resolve or execute certain acts. The delegation may be made to act
	individually or, if two or more Directors, to serve as Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The position of Director is remunerated. The Annual Mandatory Shareholders&#146;
	Meeting will set the fixed remuneration of the Board when ruling on corporate management and economic performance of the previous year expressed in the individual annual audited financial statements. The fixed remuneration corresponding to the
	President of the Board will be twice the remuneration that corresponds to any other director. As part of the directors&#146; remuneration, an additional remuneration to the diet provided to each director may be granted to the Directors that
	participate in one or more committees, according to the work they undertake at such committees. The total amount of the additional payment corresponding to all Directors shall not exceed the total amount of fixed compensation corresponding to all
	Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The term of the Board ends when the Annual Mandatory Meeting resolves on the balance of the previous fiscal year and the election of a new
	Board, but Directors will continue in position, although having concluded the term, until a new election is held, and the elected members have accepted the office.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY FIRST ARTICLE
</U>
	. The President of the Board, or whoever performs his office, shall call a meeting whenever deemed necessary or when any Director or
	the General Manager so requests it.&nbsp;The Board should gather at least four times a year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The meetings of the Board are called by the President or the
	person he designates, by means of notices with acknowledgment of receipt that shall be addressed to the domicile of each Director, with at least three day notice from the date of the meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The notices shall be delivered by registered mail, facsimile, telex, or any other means, assuring its receipt, and shall clearly specify the place, day and
	time the meeting will take place, and the matters to be discussed therein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any Director may submit for consideration of the Board, the matters deemed of
	interest for the company, although these may not be included among the matters set in the notice, and resolve about them in cases when all the members of the Board are present.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY SECOND ARTICLE
</U>
	. A call to a meeting will not be necessary when all Directors are present, and register in the Book of Minutes, their unanimous
	consent to hold a meeting without prior notice, and to discuss matters that are expressly proposed to them; the meeting can be held immediately.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY
	THIRD ARTICLE
</U>
	. A meeting of the Board is held with the attendance of half the number of the members plus one.&nbsp;If the number of members is an odd number, then the attendance required of the number of Directors is equal to the full number
	immediately higher than half of it.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Meeting of the Board where members are not present can be held through written electronic means or other nature that
	will allow communication and ensure the authenticity of the resolution, except if any one Director is opposed to use this procedure.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage216"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY FOURTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. Each Director has one vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A resolution of the Board shall be adopted by the favorable vote of the absolute majority of Directors attending.&nbsp;In case of a tie, the President shall
	have the casting vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY FIFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. A Director, who in any matter has an interest contrary to the company&#146;s shall state so to the
	Board, and not participate in the discussion and resolution concerning such matter. The impeded Director shall be deemed present for quorum purposes, but his vote shall not be calculated to establish the majority of the votes,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY SIXTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The resolutions of the meetings of the Board shall be registered in the minutes in the Book of Minutes, or in separate pages with
	the use a mechanical system, certified according to law, to be kept by the Secretary of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All Directors are entitled to have their votes and
	their grounds be registered when they so consider convenient; which can be done in respective minutes, or through a notary letter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY SEVENTH
	ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Board has the power of legal representation and of the necessary management for the administration and steering of the company with the limitations provided by law and the Bylaws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The main duties and powers of the Board are:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Conduct and control each and all the company business and activities,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Regulate their own operation,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Organize the company offices and determine their expenses,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	D)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Name and remove the General Manager, the Managers, Attorneys, representatives and any other officer on company service, delegate upon them the authority deemed convenient, specify their obligations and remunerations,
	grant them bonuses, when considered applicable, limit and revoke their powers previously delegated and establish all the rules and regulations believed necessary for the good provision of services of the company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	E)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Dispose onerously, exchange, purchase, sell, promise to purchase and give promise of sale of real property, as well as establish mortgage upon them, according to common law or under the conditions required by commercial
	banks or other public promotional institutions and other credit institutions, according to their laws and regulations, or pursuant to other special laws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	F)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Pledge assets, whether common, industrial, and mercantile or of any other nature, according to common laws, or according to special laws, whatever these may be.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	G)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Obtain and grant mutual loans, credits in checking accounts, advance or overdrafts, documentary credits, advance in checking accounts and other similar operations, with or without guarantee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	H)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Open branch offices, agencies or offices of the company deemed necessary, and reform them or close them.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	I)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Waive the domicile jurisdiction.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	J)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Propose to the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting the resolutions deemed convenient for the corporate interests.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	K)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Submit annually to the Mandatory Shareholders&#146; Meeting, the General Balance and the Annual Report of the fiscal year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	L)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Render accounts
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	M)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Grant general or special powers to complete one or several acts referred to in foregoing sub items, except those referred in foregoing sub items K) and L), modify or renew them.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	N)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Delegate all or some of the powers, except those referred in foregoing sub items K) and L).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	O)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Review, approve any other type of contracts required to fulfill corporate purposes that exceeds the powers of Management.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	P)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Ensure compliance of legal and statutory provisions, as well as the resolutions of the General Meeting, being authorize to dictate and modify in-house regulations,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	Q)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Discuss and resolve all the other matters that according to these Bylaws are not submitted to resolutions by the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	VI.
<U>
	MANAGEMENT
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY EIGHTH
	ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Company will have one General Manager who will be appointed by the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The General Manager is in charge of the
	administration of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The General Management may be the responsibility of a natural or a legal person, when a legal person is named Manager,
	immediately one or more natural persons representing the legal person shall be named for this purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FORTY NINTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Management
	is responsible of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Organizing the internal system of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Conduct all the business activities of the Company, in order to maintain it in optimum conditions of productive technique, of administrative, commercial and financial efficiency, safety, legal efficiency and validity,
	economic profitability and technological progress. For this, he is authorized to execute actions and regular contracts concerning the corporate purpose, as well as the work, the Board and the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting shall entrust upon
	him.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Responding for the existence, regularity and authenticity of the books that the law orders the company to keep and issue the correspondence of the same.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	D)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Name and remove officers or technicians of high responsibility and high remuneration, determining their obligations and remunerations, as well as employees and workers that are required, promote them, change their
	functions and set their remunerations.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage218"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	E)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Represent the Company before any kind of authorities, whether political, administrative, fiscal, municipal or legal, with general and special powers of articles 74 and 75 of the Civil Procedural Code.&nbsp;Consequently,
	the Manager is authorized to conduct all the acts of disposal of substantive and procedural law and, in particular, to sue, counterclaim, respond to suits and counterclaims, abandon proceedings, acquiesce the claim, compromise, submit to arbitration
	controversial issues, substitute or delegate procedural representation, and for all the other acts required by law.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	F)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Account for the course and condition of Corporate Business when the Board so requests.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	G)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Order payments and collection
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	H)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Jointly with another Manager or Company Attorney, he is authorized to agree and verify credit operations deemed necessary; open, close and manage checking, deposit or credit accounts, in local or foreign currency,
	within or outside the country, deposit, draw and acknowledge statements or contest them; enter into credit agreements in checking accounts, with or without guarantee, for the product of the same be applied to paying obligations of the company or be
	deposited in its accounts, complete any kind of operations concerning bills of exchange, checks, promissory notes, warrants, letters or orders of credit, invoices or other commercial or bank documents, whether to order or to bearer, the same that he
	will draw, subscribe, accept, reaccept, ratify, extend, endorse, whether as guarantee, collection, discount, or fee simple, guarantee, cancel and negotiate and order a protest, as applicable and deemed convenient; request credits through notes,
	promissory notes or checking account, in local or foreign currency, for the product of the same be applied to paying obligations of the company or be deposited in its accounts; rent safe deposit boxes, use them and terminate the rent; register and
	acquire trademarks, register, obtain and buy patents; and endorse freight bills and bills of lading.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	I)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Exercise the other functions that the Board may entrust upon him, as well as to conduct administrative actions deemed necessary or convenient to fulfill the corporate purposes, as well as to exercise any other authority
	according to the nature of his office and that are not in opposition with statements by these Bylaws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTIETH ARTICLE
</U>
	. The Board
	may also name one or more Managers and Assistant Managers that will have the authority agreed to in their respective appointments or in by separate acts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	VII.
<U>
	INDEMNIFICATION FOR DIRECTORS AND GENERAL MANAGER
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY FIRST ARTICLE.
</U>
	The company will take responsibility for all reasonable expenses in which the Board or the general manager may incur, as well as
	the damages they are obliged to pay regarding any action, trial or procedure in which they may have been part for being Director or general manager, except those in which is it determined by judicial or arbitral definitive statement that may have
	been caused as a result of agreements or acts against the law or the bylaws, or for wishful misconduct, abuse of authority or gross negligence, in which case, the involved Director or general manager will remain obliged to refund the company, all
	the expenses incurred by the company.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage219"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	VIII.
<U>
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PROFIT APPLICATION
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY SECOND ARTICLE
</U>
	. Within a maximum term of eighty calendar days after December 31
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	st
</SUP>
	of each
	year, the Board shall prepare the Annual Report and the Financial Statements of the Company at December&nbsp;31 of the previous year, according to provisions set forth by the General Law of Companies and the General Accounting Plan, as well as a
	proposal for the application of the profits; these documents shall be submitted for the approval of the Annual Mandatory General Shareholders&#146; Meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Financial Statements shall be signed by the Accountant and countersigned by the President of the Board or the General Manager, or the legal representative
	duly authorized for this purpose.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY THIRD ARTICLE
</U>
	. The General Shareholders&#146; Meeting may agree, prior approval of applicable Financial
	Statements, the distribution of provisional dividends from net gains of the annual fiscal year, provided the Company has no accumulated losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	profits resulting from Annual Financial Statements, after discounting all expenses, making corrections and having deduced the necessary amount to create a reserve fund or reserves to be created according to law, shall be applied as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Remuneration of the Board.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The remaining amount, should the Board decide so, shall be capitalized the amount agreed by the Meeting.&nbsp;IN this case, the shares issued in terms of capitalization shall be delivered to shareholders proportionally
	to the nominal value of the shares they posses, and if by virtue of the number of shares possessed by each shareholder, the distribution among them of the shares so issued are not exactly possible, the shareholders will compensate among them the
	differences or, if this is not convenient, it will be adjudicated by lot among them, the remaining shares that cannot be fully distributed, in order to respect the principle of indivisibility of each share.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Of the remaining, the General Meeting shall agree the amount to establish a special fund or voluntary reserve.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The final balance that may still remain shall be distributed as dividend among the shareholders.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	IX.
<U>
	CORPORATE DISSOLUTION AND LIQUIDATION
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY FOURTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. If a case of liquidation arises, the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting that resolves on the liquidation, shall designate the
	natural persons or legal persons that will take charge; during the liquidation period the regulations of these Bylaws shall be observed wherever applicable, those stipulated by the General Law of Companies, the Code of Commerce, in other applicable
	laws and in the Regulations of the Mercantile Registry and the resolutions of the General Meetings.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage220"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY FIFTH ARTICLE
</U>
	. If after having paid the debts of the Company there is a remaining balance, this
	should be distributed pro rata among all shareholders proportionately to the nominal capital representing the shares they posses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Further, once the
	liquidation is completed, the shareholders shall designate the person or entity that will keep the books and the documents of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	X.
<U>
	DISPUTE RESOLUTION
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	FIFTY SIXTH
	ARTICLE
</U>
	. Any dispute, disagreement or conflict arising between shareholders, between shareholders and the Company, or between the Company and its Directors during the existence or dissolution process of the Company, in connection to their rights
	or obligations or in connection to the interpretation, application, validity or compliance with this By-laws or in connection with any agreement adopted by the Company&#146;s General Shareholders&#146; Meetings or Board of Directors&#146; meetings,
	which have not been resolved through direct negotiation and in amicable terms between the parties, or by means of mediation or conciliation, within thirty (30) business days from the notification to one of the parties, the parties agree to waive
	their rights to solve any dispute, disagreement or conflict within the competent courts of their domiciles and agree that all disputes, disagreements or conflicts will be settled by arbitration at law, except for those disputes which shall be
	ventilated under a specific jurisdiction as mandated by law, in which case the Peruvian Arbitration Law (Legislative Decree No. 1071), or any law amending or replacing it, shall be applied as well as the additional provisions established for such
	effects.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The arbitration will be held in Lima, Per&uacute; and in Spanish language according to the agreements in this clause. For all the matters not
	provided herein, the arbitration shall be organized and conducted in accordance with the provisions set forth in the Rules and Regulations of the Arbitration Center of the American Chamber of Commerce of Per&uacute; (AmCham Per&uacute;).
	-&nbsp;
<I>
	C&aacute;mara de Comercio Americana del Per&uacute;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tribunal shall consist of three (03) arbitrators, following the rules below for
	their designation:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) The party requesting the arbitration shall submit the first request to the Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute; indicating the
	name of the person designated as first arbitrator, and inviting the opposing party, in turn, to designate the second arbitrator. The Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute; shall submit a copy of the first request to the opposing party.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage221"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Five calendar days after receiving the copy of the request referred to in letter (a) above, the opposing
	party shall indicate the name of the person designated as second arbitrator. If the opposing party fails to designate an arbitrator within the stated term, the Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute; shall designate the second arbitrator.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Five calendar days after the designation of the second arbitration pursuant to the provisions in (b), both parties shall, mutually agree, on the person
	who will serve as third arbitrator, who will chair the Tribunal. In the event that the parties fail to reach an agreement, the Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute; shall designate the Chair of the Tribunal upon the request of either of the
	parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tribunal shall decide by majority on the subject matter of the arbitration. For this purpose, the Tribunal shall issue an arbitration award
	and the reasons therefore in writing within the term set in the By-laws and Regulations of the Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute;. The arbitration award shall be final, binding upon the parties and unappealable, unless otherwise provided in
	the applicable rules.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the arbitration award shall determine the manner to confront the expenses related to the arbitration pursuant to the
	provisions set forth by the rules of the Arbitration Center of AmCham Per&uacute;.
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_1>

	Jan.&nbsp;1

<BR>

<BR>
	(STAGE&nbsp;I)
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	15-31
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:8PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Dec.
<BR>
	(STAGE&nbsp;I)
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

	Additionally, a 5% tolerance on the maximum contracted power is allowed.

	Minimum power (purchase obligation):

<B>
	Exclusivity:
</B>
	Exclusive electricity supply (up to the maximum power supply contractually agreed).
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage223"></A>
